alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 5:14AM CDT until August 08 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following areas, Ogle and northern De Kalb Counties. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain moving into the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... DeKalb, Sycamore, Rochelle, Genoa, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Polo, Cortland, Davis Junction, Kirkland, Forreston, Hillcrest, Maple Park, Malta, Kingston, Stillman Valley, Lost Nation, Creston and Lindenwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
